• API reference
  • Main Page
Sensor API

The Bosch Sensor APIs provide a user friendly interface to access sensors. Some of the Sensor API operations are:

  • Enable/disable a sensor.
  • Configure a sensor(s) acquisition data rate and power mode.
  • Retrieve sensor information like acquisition frequency, interrupt status.
  • Confirm availability of a sensor.

Highlights of Sensor API

  • Supports all major C/C++ compilers ( tested with gcc-arm-none-eabi-5.4.1 ).
  • Can create multiple handles to access sensors and has a easy-to-use communication interface.
  • Has an active online community to support bug resolution and new feature development (https://community.bosch-sensortec.com)
  • Is available with clear, concise documentation. Additionally, the user can request for custom examples by raising a ticket in the Bosch community.
  • Available with source code so the user can customize as per needs.(https://github.com/BoschSensortec)

The diagram below shows the interface between the Application and Sensor API.

Folder Structure

A general folder structure in which files are layered according to complexity is as shown below:

Note: "hal" is hardware abstraction layer that varies based on the board ( eg, COINES ) and the type of communication protocol ( eg, SPI/I2C).

Example usage

A basic usage of sensor APIs for BMA is as seen below. For more information, please refer to the respective API documentation ( eg, BMA400->examples->accelerometer.c )

int main ( void )
{
   /* Sensor handle or instance */
   struct bma400_dev bma;
   /* Read: Mapping of bus read function */
   bma.read = bma400_example_hal_bus_read;
   /* Write: Mapping of bus write function */
   bma.write = bma400_example_hal_bus_write;
   /* Delay: Mapping of delay function */
   bma.delay_ms = bma400_example_hal_delay_ms;
   /* Interface Selection
   * SPI: BMA400_SPI_INTF
   * I2C: BMA400_I2C_INTF
   */
   bma.intf = BMA400_SPI_INTF;
   /* Device ID
   * SPI : Could be used to identify the chip select line
   * I2C : BMA400_I2C_ADDRESS_SDO_LOW or BMA400_I2C_ADDRESS_SDO_HIGH
   */
   bma.dev_id = 0;
   /* Initialization of sensor*/
   bma400_init(&bma);
   /* Get sensor data */
   struct bma400_sensor_data accel_data;
   bma400_get_accel_data(BMA400_DATA_ONLY, &accel_data, &bma);
   printf("RAW XYZ values : %d, %d, %d\n", accel_data.x, accel_data.y, accel_data.z);
}

Templates for function pointers

The same template is avaliable in repsective API's example folder ( eg., BMA400->examples->hal->bma400_hal_custom.c )

int8_t bma400_example_hal_bus_read(uint8_t dev_id, uint8_t reg_addr, uint8_t *reg_data,      uint16_t length)
{
   int8_t rslt = 0;
   /*
   * I2C bus read
   */
   /*
   * Data on the bus should be like
   * |------------+------------------------|
   * | I2C action | Data       |
   * |------------+------------------------|
   * |    Start   | -       |
   * |    Write   |      (reg_addr)       |
   * |    Stop    | -       |
   * |    Start   | -       |
   * |    Write   |      (reg_addr)       |
   * |    Read    |     (reg_data[0])     |
   * |    Read    | (....)       |
   * |    Read    | (reg_data[length - 1]) |
   * |    Stop    | -       |
   * |------------+------------------------|
   */
   /*
   * SPI bus read
   */
   /*
   * The parameter dev_id can be used as a variable to select which Chip Select pin has
   * to be set low to activate the relevant device on the SPI bus
   */
   /*
   * Data on the bus should be like
   * |----------------+------------------------+-------------|
   * |     MOSI  |      MISO   | Chip Select |
   * |----------------+------------------------|-------------|
   * |  (don't care)  |  (don't care)   |     HIGH    |
   * |   (reg_addr)   |  (don't care)   |     LOW     |
   * |  (don't care)  |  (reg_data[0])   |     LOW     |
   * |     (....) |     (....)   |     LOW     |
   * |  (don't care)  | (reg_data[length - 1]) |     LOW     |
   * |  (don't care)  |  (don't care)   |     HIGH    |
   * |----------------+------------------------|-------------|
   */
   /* Return 0 for Success, non-zero for failure */
   return rslt;
}
int8_t bma400_example_hal_bus_write(uint8_t dev_id, uint8_t reg_addr, const uint8_t *reg_data,       uint16_t length)
{
   int8_t rslt = 0;
   /*
   * I2C bus write
   */
   /*
   * Data on the bus should be like
   * |------------+------------------------|
   * | I2C action | Data       |
   * |------------+------------------------|
   * |    Start   | -       |
   * |    Write   |      (reg_addr)       |
   * |    Write   |     (reg_data[0])     |
   * |    Write   | (....)       |
   * |    Write   | (reg_data[length - 1]) |
   * |    Stop    | -       |
   * |------------+------------------------|
   */
   /*
   * SPI bus write
   */
   /*
   * The parameter dev_id can be used as a variable to select which Chip Select pin has
   * to be set low to activate the relevant device on the SPI bus
   */
   /*
   * Data on the bus should be like
   * |------------------------+--------------+-------------|
   * |    MOSI  |    MISO | Chip Select |
   * |------------------------+--------------|-------------|
   * | (don't care)  | (don't care) |     HIGH    |
   * |        (reg_addr)      | (don't care) |     LOW     |
   * | (reg_data[0])  | (don't care) |     LOW     |
   * |   (....)  |   (....) |     LOW     |
   * | (reg_data[length - 1]) | (don't care) |     LOW     |
   * | (don't care)  | (don't care) |     HIGH    |
   * |------------------------+--------------|-------------|
   */
   /* Return 0 for Success, non-zero for failure */
   return rslt;
}
void bma400_example_hal_delay_ms(uint32_t ms)
{
   /*
   * Return control or wait,
   * for a period amount of milliseconds
   */
}

Experiment API using COINES

COmmunication with INertial and Environmental Sensors (COINES) is a low-level interface to the Bosch Sensortec's Application Board APP2.0. COINES is used with the SensorAPI of the required sensor to access the application. The user can access Bosch Sensortec's MEMS sensors through a C interface to modify, compile, and run sample applications.

With sample codes and the Bosch Sensortec's Application Board APP2.0, the user can see how to use the SensorAPI in an embedded environment by running sample codes. They can also create their own applications easily based on the sample codes for testing and debugging.

References

  • To download coines, please refer to: https://www.bosch-sensortec.com/bst/support_tools/downloads/overview_downloads
  • For Source code of SensorAPI, please refer to: https://github.com/BoschSensortec

Note: Source code of sample applications and SensorAPI are provided with the COINES library as a package.
